entry.title: The White Lotus's Haley Lu Richardson's Cute Blush Makeup Look | Beauty Secrets | Vogue

media:group.media:title: The White Lotus's Haley Lu Richardson's Cute Blush Makeup Look | Beauty Secrets | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
27-year-old actor Haley Lu Richardson walks us through her skin-care and makeup routine‚Äîfrom ingestible supplements to rosy blush. Haley talks with us about her passion for pole dancing, her incredible cardboard cutout collection (featuring the likes of Miley Cyrus and mezzo-soprano Susan Boyle), and her experiences on set with the iconic Jennifer Coolidge. She also brings out some makeup gifted to her by good friend Peyton List, and explains why she's never felt cuter than with a bit of blush on the tip of her nose.

media:group.media:description: Coperni‚Äôs spring 2023 show dedicated its runway to ‚Äúwomen of this world.‚Äù Bella Hadid takes center stage as the main event. Three men spray painted a dress onto her body. The dress was completed by another artist who used her hands and a pair of scissors to sculpt Bella‚Äôs dress.

entry.title: Isabela Merced's Girls' Night Out Makeup Look | Beauty Secrets | Vogue

media:group.media:title: Isabela Merced's Girls' Night Out Makeup Look | Beauty Secrets | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Actor Isabela Merced shows off her fun "girls' night out" makeup look. Watch as Isabela talks about not only her approach to skin care (which changes depending on the season), but her methodology on choosing acting roles. After having stress-related panic attacks, Isabela decided "two movies a year" was more than enough and provided her with a better work-life balance. Isabela also talks about how co-stars Sydney Sweeney and Celeste O'Connor kept her sane while on the set of Madame Web.

entry.title: Ep. 6 - A Black Fashion Revolution | Supreme Models

media:group.media:title: Ep. 6 - A Black Fashion Revolution | Supreme Models
media:group.media:description:
We‚Äôre in a new era where Black people are now occupying every area of fashion and beyond where Black models have become activists fighting for body inclusivity. Precious Lee tells the story of her journey plus we take a closer look at the Black Models using their platforms to spark social change within the fashion industry. Highlighted are the lingering effects of racism, the impact of the Black Lives Matter movement and the pandemic upon fashion. Also covered are the changes over time around awareness of body positivity, diversity and inclusion, influencer culture, and social media. We also look at the Black In Fashion Council and how it‚Äôs helped facilitate Black photographers, Black models, and more. Paloma Elsesser discusses her first Vogue cover and we hear from Iman, Anna Wintour, Poppy Ajudha, Joan Smalls, Zendaya, Aweng Chuol, and many more as they discuss the state of the industry and where it‚Äôs headed - as well as the impact of colorism.
Music Featured: ‚ÄúWake Me Up‚Äù Written by Frederik Helmut Wiedmann, Gemma Hyesu Wiedmann Performed by Emily Jaye Courtesy of MicDrop
‚ÄúAll Love‚Äù Written by Randolph Newman, Myles Morales Performed by Myles Williams & Titus Courtesy of MicDrop
‚ÄúDrastic Measure‚Äù Written by Randolph Newman, Myles Morales Performed by Myles Williams & Titus Courtesy of MicDrop
‚ÄúBlack Joy. Black Peace. Black Justice‚Äù Written and performed by Poppy Ajudha Courtesy of Poppy Ajudha
‚ÄúBetter Blues‚Äù Written by Kevin Toulson, Jr, Payton Augustus Long, Rodney Roy Jerkins Performed by Stam Goody Courtesy of Raedio
‚ÄúQueenDom Come‚Äù Written by Joshua Devon Walker Performed by JD Walker Courtesy of Beatclub 0:00 The Black Renaissance 1:42 Precious Lee‚Äôs Story 4:47 Model Activism 8:48 The Black In Fashion Council 10:57 Black Photographers 13:16 Aweng Chuol & Fenty 17:20 Black Representation Explodes 20:22 Inclusivity 21:47 Looking Forward

media:group.media:title: Christina Aguilera Breaks Down 12 Looks From Moulin Rouge to Dirrty | Life in Looks | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Pop star Christina Aguilera revisits her best‚Äîand boldest‚Äîoutfits over her career. Spanning from her debut record to the VMAs, Dirrty, and Moulin Rouge, watch as Christina reminisces about iconic look after iconic look.
In celebration of the 20th anniversary of Stripped, check out Christina Aguilera's new version of Beautiful - https://youtu.be/7kEwGXLdbZ8
Christina‚Äôs EP, LA LUZ, is now streaming, and full length album, AGUILERA, is now available.

entry.title: Chlo√´ Grace Moretz's "Off-Duty" Beauty Routine | Beauty Secrets | Vogue

media:group.media:title: Chlo√´ Grace Moretz's "Off-Duty" Beauty Routine | Beauty Secrets | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Actor Chlo√´ Grace Moretz takes Vogue through her skin-care and off-duty makeup routine. Chlo√´ talks about how her towels and pillowcases were causing break outs and how olive oil was a major factor in treating her cystic acne. Chlo√´ also shows off her flawless Mr. Napkin Head impression (watch out Jude Law!) and shares some useful beauty advice she got from the one and only Emilio Est√©vez.
The Peripheral episodes debut weekly starting October 21st on Prime Video

entry.title: Ep. 5 - Era of One Black Model Per Runway | Supreme Models

media:group.media:title: Ep. 5 - Era of One Black Model Per Runway | Supreme Models
media:group.media:description:
The 2000‚Äôs and the White Out. Casting agents, celebrities, fashion designers, magazine editors, and top Black models discuss the White Out, the years between the mid-nineties and mid-2010‚Äôs when the Black model disappeared from the fashion runways. In revealing interviews, trailblazers Edward Enninful, Bethann Hardison and Iman, and top models Cindy Bruna, Sessilee Lopez, Jourdana Phillips, Joan Smalls, and Jeneil Williams share personal stories about a controversial era in fashion.
Supreme Models is a 6-part documentary. New episodes premiere Mondays.
Music Featured: ‚ÄúA Thousand Cuts‚Äù Written by Ruby Ibarra and Macaraeg Angelo Ancheta Performed by Ruby Ibarra Courtesy of Ruby Ibarra Entertainment, LLC. By arrangement with Blue Buddha Entertainment L.L.C.
‚ÄúSerenate‚Äù Written by Frederik Helmut Wiedmann Courtesy of MicDrop

‚ÄúAre You Ready‚Äù Written by Chaz Mason, Maggie Szabo and Stefan Lit Performed by Lady Sway Courtesy of Gravelpit Music

entry.title: Inside Balmain Designer Olivier Rousteing‚Äôs Home Filled With Wonderful Objects | Vogue

media:group.media:title: Inside Balmain Designer Olivier Rousteing‚Äôs Home Filled With Wonderful Objects | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Designer Olivier Rousteing opens up the doors of his Parisian apartment. By his own admission, Olivier has an obsession with black and gold‚Äîjust look at his collections for Balmain, the storied Parisian fashion house he‚Äôs helmed since 2011. So is it any surprise that, when Vogue asked the designer to name his favorite things in his Paris home for the latest episode of ‚ÄúObjects of Affection,‚Äù most of them abided by that very color scheme?

entry.title: Bette Midler Breaks Down 13 Looks From Hocus Pocus to the Met Gala | Life in Looks | Vogue

media:group.media:title: Bette Midler Breaks Down 13 Looks From Hocus Pocus to the Met Gala | Life in Looks | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Did you know that Bette Midler came up with her own Hocus Pocus makeup? In this episode of "Life in Looks" the iconic singer-actor dishes on her most iconic fashion looks, from her early days on broadway to major motion pictures and glamorous red carpets.

entry.title: Model Lila Moss‚Äôs Guide to Contouring and Next-Level Lashes | Beauty Secrets | Vogue

media:group.media:title: Model Lila Moss‚Äôs Guide to Contouring and Next-Level Lashes | Beauty Secrets | Vogue
media:group.media:description:
Rising runway star Lila Moss walks us through her routine‚Äîand reveals the beauty lessons she's learned from her supermodel mom. That advice? "Less is more," says Lila, as she repeats the wise words passed down from her mother, the legendary Kate Moss. Artists like Doja Cat and Rihanna provide the soundtrack as Lila gets ready with friends before going out. Lila also talks about some of her biggest beauty inspirations, like fellow model Hailey Bieber and dance superstar Maddie Ziegler.
